abstract.text: Improve navigation behavior in your app by replacing navigation views
with navigation stacks and navigation split views.

For example, if you have a navigation view with links
that activate in response to individual state variables:
When some other part of your code sets one of the state variables

You can support even more sophisticated programmatic navigation

inlineContent.text: Using the same properties, you can rewrite the body as:
The list coordinates with the navigation logic
so that changing the selection state variable
in another part of your code
activates the navigation link with the corresponding color.
Similarly, if someone chooses the navigation link
the list updates the selection value
that other parts of your code can read.

content.text: Provide backward compatibility with an availability check

inlineContent.text: If your app needs to run on platform versions earlier than
iOS 16, iPadOS 16, macOS 13, tvOS 16, watchOS 9, or visionOS 1,
you can start migration while continuing to support older clients
you can create a custom wrapper view that conditionally uses

code: where Sidebar: View, Content: View, Detail: View

inlineContent.text: Customize the wrapper to meet your app’s needs.
For example, you can add a navigation split view style modifier

SwiftUI-PageImage-card.png.alt: A black Swift logo on a swirly blue and purple background.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
Use navigation links, stacks, destinations, and paths to provide a streamlined experience for all platforms, as well as behaviors such as deep linking and state restoration.

doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/Sw.title: Bringing robust navigation structure to your SwiftUI app

abstract.text: A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column,
optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
Enable people to move between different parts of your app’s view hierarchy
within a scene.
A view that controls a navigation presentation.
Creates a navigation link that presents the view corresponding to a
codable value.
A type-erased list of data representing the content of a navigation stack.
A view that presents views in two or three columns, where selections in
leading columns control presentations in subsequent columns.
Creates a three-column navigation split view.
Creates a two-column navigation split view.
The visibility of the leading columns in a navigation split view.
A view that displays a root view and enables you to present additional
views over the root view.
Creates a navigation stack with homogeneous navigation state that you
can control.
A view for presenting a stack of views that represents a visible path in a
navigation hierarchy.
A navigation view style represented by a view stack that only shows a single
top view at a time.
Associates a destination view with a presented data type for use within
a navigation stack.
Sets a fixed, preferred width for the column containing this view.
Sets a flexible, preferred width for the column containing this view.
Sets the style for navigation split views within this view.
